paragraphs.title: Introduction
paragraphs.text:
%md
This unix shell (`sh`) workbook will generate a rasterised GeoTIFF image from the aggrated Monte Carlo data. The variables are not scoped for the entire workbook, therefore the varaibles must be within the same code block. An exit value `143` denotes a time-out for the code block this can resolved by increasing the time-out value in the `sh` interpretor settings.

msg.data: This unix shell (sh) workbook will generate a rasterised GeoTIFF image from the aggrated Monte Carlo data. The variables are not scoped for the entire workbook, therefore the varaibles must be within the same code block. An exit value 143 denotes a time-out for the code block this can resolved by increasing the time-out value in the sh interpretor settings.

paragraphs.text:
%sh
# File paths
aggregatedResults="/data/results/aggregated_richness"
outputPath="/data/results/geotiff_aggregated_richness"

# Create output directory if missing
if [ ! -d "$outputPath" ]; then
    mkdir -p $outputPath
fi

# Add headers for result CSV
echo "WKT,MODAL_CLASS,TOTRICH_78,TOTRICH_VAR_78,TOTRICH_90,TOTRICH_VAR_90,TOTRICH_98,TOTRICH_VAR_98,TOTRICH_07,TOTRICH_VAR_07" > $outputPath/result.csv

# Concatenate aggregated files to single CSV
cat $aggregatedResults/part-* >> $outputPath/result.csv


# Generate raster
gdal_rasterize -a TOTRICH_07 -ts 3000 3000 -l result $outputPath/result.csv $outputPath/result.tif
